verbose_text: A preliminary investigation in this study demonstrated that isorhamnetin, tamarixetin, and quercetin all increased the antiaggregatory effects of aspirin in a synergistic, i.e., more-than-additive manner, lowering IC 50 values by over an order of magnitude at higher concentrations.
evidence: isorhamnetin, tamarixetin, and quercetin all increased the antiaggregatory effects of aspirin
